viStories.title: Đói bụng (Hungry)
viStories.focusWords: tôi, ăn, không, đói. New words in context: cơm (rice), bạn (friend).

viStories.title: Đi học (Going to School)

sentences.vi: Tôi chơi với bạn sau giờ học.
sentences.en: I play with friends after class.

viStories.focusWords: tôi, học, sách, bạn. New words in context: giờ học (class), chơi (play).

viStories.title: Chơi bóng (Playing Ball)

sentences.vi: Bạn tôi ném bóng cho tôi.
sentences.en: My friend throws the ball to me.

viStories.focusWords: tôi, chơi, bạn, bóng. New words in context: sân (yard), vui (fun).

tlStories.title: Nagugutom (Hungry)

sentences.tl: Binigyan ako ng kaibigan ko ng kanin.

tlStories.focusWords: ako, kumain, wala, gutom. New words in context: kanin (rice), kaibigan (friend).

tlStories.title: Pumunta sa Paaralan (Going to School)

sentences.tl: Dala ko ang aking mga libro.
Naglaro kami ng kaibigan ko pagkatapos ng klase.
sentences.en: I play with my friend after class.

tlStories.focusWords: ako, paaralan, libro, kaibigan. New words in context: klase (class), maglaro (play).

tlStories.title: Naglaro ng Bola (Playing Ball)

sentences.tl: Hinihagis sa akin ng kaibigan ko ang bola.
sentences.en: My friend throws the ball to me.

tlStories.focusWords: ako, laro, kaibigan, bola. New words in context: labas (outside), masaya (fun).

jpStories.title: Onaka ga suita (Hungry)
jpStories.focusWords: watashi, taberu, nai, onaka. New words in context: gohan (rice), tomodachi (friend).

jpStories.title: Gakkou e iku (Going to School)

sentences.jp: Watashi wa nihongo o benkyou suru.
Gakkou no ato tomodachi to asobu.
sentences.en: I play with friends after class.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, benkyou, hon, tomodachi. New words in context: gakkou (school), asobu (play).

jpStories.title: Booru asobi (Playing Ball)

sentences.jp: Tomodachi ga booru o nage ta.
sentences.en: My friend throws the ball to me.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, asobu, tomodachi, booru. New words in context: soto (outside), tanoshii (fun).

jpStories.title: Kaimono (Shopping)
jpStories.focusWords: watashi, kau, ureshi, ichiba. New words in context: yasai (vegetables), kudamono (fruits).

jpStories.title: Ie de (At Home)

sentences.jp: Kazoku to issho ni bangohan o taberu.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, ie, taberu, yomu. New words in context: ryouri (cook), kazoku (family).

jpStories.title: Sanpo (Going for a Walk)

sentences.en: I go for a walk in the park.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, sanpo, tomodachi, miru. New words in context: kouen (park), hana (flower).

jpStories.title: Tenki (Weather)
jpStories.focusWords: kyou, watashi, motsu, ame. New words in context: hare (sunny), kasa (umbrella), atsui (hot).

jpStories.title: Basu ni noru (Taking the Bus)

sentences.jp: Watashi wa basu de gakkou e iku.
sentences.en: I take the bus to school.
I get off at the last stop.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, noru, kippu, eki. New words in context: basu (bus), oriru (get off).

jpStories.title: Neru (Going to Sleep)
jpStories.focusWords: watashi, neru, furo, kiru. New words in context: migaku (brush teeth), pajama (pajamas).

jpStories.title: Petto to asobu (Playing with Pets)

sentences.jp: Watashi wa neko o motte iru.

jpStories.focusWords: watashi, neko, ageru, asobu. New words in context: petto (pet), daisuki (love).
